Package br.com.kirgh.app.repositories

Interface AddressRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Address,UUID>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Address,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Address,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Address,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Address,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Address>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Address,UUID>
public interface AddressRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Address,UUID>
This code is defining an interface called AddressRepository that extends the JpaRepository interface. The JpaRepository interface is a Spring Data interface that provides methods for performing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on a specific entity type (Address in this case) in a database. The UUID parameter specifies the type of the primary key for the Address entity.

  • Method Details

    • existsToUserByUnique

      @Query(nativeQuery=true, value=" SELECT\n CASE\n WHEN (COUNT(1) > 0) THEN\n true\n ELSE\n false\n END\n FROM\n address_relations rel\n INNER JOIN\n addresses adr\n ON\n adr.id = rel.address_id\n AND zip_code = :zipCode\n AND number = :number\n WHERE\n parent_id = :userId\n") boolean existsToUserByUnique(@Param("userId") UUID userId, @Param("zipCode") String zipCode, @Param("number") String number)
      This is a Java function that checks if a specific address exists for a given user based on their ID, zip code, and number.
      Parameters:
      userId - a String representing the ID of a user
      zipCode - The zip code of an address.
      number - The parameter number is a String representing the street number of an address.
      Returns:
      A boolean value is being returned.

    • findAll

      org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Address> findAll(org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification spec, org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageRequest)
      The function returns a page of addresses that match the given specification and pageable parameters.
      Parameters:
      spec - The spec parameter is a Specification object that represents the criteria or conditions to be used for filtering the addresses. It can be used to specify conditions such as filtering by certain fields or properties of the Address entity.
      pageRequest - Pageable is an interface that represents a request for a specific page of data. It includes information such as the page number, the number of items per page, and sorting options.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a Page object containing a list of Address objects that match the given Specification, with pagination applied according to the provided Pageable object.

    • getAllAddressesBoundUser

      @Query(nativeQuery=true, value=" SELECT\n addresses.id, addresses.zip_code, addresses.street, addresses.number, addresses.city, addresses.state\n FROM\n addresses\n INNER JOIN\n address_relations\n ON\n addresses.id = address_relations.address_id\n WHERE\n address_relations.parent_id = :parentId\n") List<Address> getAllAddressesBoundUser(@Param("parentId") UUID parentId)
      The function retrieves all addresses associated with a specific parent ID.
      Parameters:
      parentId - The parentId parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that is used to filter the addresses based on the parent ID.
      Returns:
      The query is returning a list of Address objects.

    • deleteAddressById

      @Transactional @Modifying @Query(nativeQuery=true, value=" DELETE FROM\n addresses\n WHERE\n id = :addressId\n") void deleteAddressById(@Param("addressId") UUID addressId)
      The function deletes an address from the addresses table in the database based on the provided addressId.
      Parameters:
      addressId - The addressId parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of the address to be deleted.
